The Barclays Arrival Plus card is a great choice, and I'm sure you'll enjoy the 70,000-mile bonus.

It's great to hear that you had a good experience flying with Air France from JFK to LAX. Flying from JFK to Paris on Air France can be a fantastic option, especially if you're hoping to get an upgrade to premium economy using your miles.

If you're planning to use your miles for an upgrade, make sure to check the availability of premium economy seats on your desired flight dates. You can do this by logging into your Flying Blue account or contacting their customer service.

Additionally, consider booking a flexible ticket or a ticket with more upgrade availability to increase your chances of getting upgraded. You can also set up alerts for upgrade availability or use a tool like ExpertFlyer to monitor seat availability.

Remember to also check the Flying Blue award chart to see how many miles you'll need for an upgrade from economy to premium economy. You can also consider transferring miles from other loyalty programs or earning more miles through credit cards, hotel stays, or other activities to reach the required amount.

Good luck with your upgrade, and I hope you enjoy your flight to Paris!
